intro: Apicra, commonly known as the "spiky beauty," is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive, spiky foliage. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with sharp, pointed tips, giving it a striking appearance. Apicra thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
